segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro upāsako sukkāya bhikkhuniyā bhojanaṃ adāsi.
segments.en: Now at that time a certain lay follower gave food to the nun Sukkā.

segments.pli: Atha kho sukkāya bhikkhuniyā abhippasanno yakkho rājagahe rathikāya rathikaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ upasaṅkamitvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi:
segments.en: Then a native spirit was so devoted to Sukkā that he went street to street and square to square, and on that occasion recited these verses:
“O! He has made so much merit!
That lay follower is so very wise.
He just gave food to Sukkā,
who is released from all ties.”

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha,…

suttaplex.blurb: A spirit was full of faith in the nun Sukkā, so he went about the towns and villages singing the benefits of giving her offerings.
